detaileddescription.para: Speed of light in vacuum : $ c=299 792 458 m/s $

memberdef.argsstring: (double _t_obs, double _spin_period, double *_gain_tx, double *_gain_rx, double _wavelength, double _power_tx, double *_range_tx_m, double *_range_rx_m, double _duty_cycle, double _diameter, double _bandwidth, double _rx_noise_temp, double _radar_albedo, double *_snr_coh, double *_snr_incoh, int _N)
memberdef.name: doppler_spread_hard_target_snr_vectorized

sect1.title: Description
sect1.para: This function computes the coherent and incoherent signal-to-noise (SNR) ratios for a spinning rigid target by taking into account the doppler shift.

para.verbatim: embed:rst:leading-asterisk * .. note:: * The current implementation of the function does not support array inputs over * all parameters *

parameterdescription.para: (double) rotation period of the object being observed (s)
(double) radar albedo of the object beaing observed (-)

para.emphasis: D. Kastinen et al., Radar observability of near-Earth objects with EISCAT 3D, 2020,

memberdef.name: doppler_spread_hard_target_snr

sect1.title: Description
sect1.para: This function computes the coherent and incoherent signal-to-noise (SNR) ratios for a spinning rigid target by taking into account the doppler shift.

parameterdescription.para: (double) rotation period of the object being observed (s)
(double) radar albedo of the object beaing observed (-)

listitem.para: D. Kastinen et al., Radar observability of near-Earth objects with EISCAT 3D, 2020,

memberdef.name: incoherent_snr

sect1.title: Description
sect1.para: Computes the incoherent signal to noise ratio and the minimal observation time required

parameterdescription.para: (double) statistical significance criterion used for a detection (-)
(double) incoherent integration time of the measurements (s)

listitem.para: D. Kastinen et al.: Radar observability of near-Earth objects with EISCAT 3D, 2020

memberdef.argsstring: (double *_gain_tx, double *_gain_rx, double _wavelength, double _power_tx, double *_range_tx_m, double *_range_rx_m, double *_snr, double _bandwidth, double _rx_noise_temp, double _radar_albedo, double *_diameter, int _N)
memberdef.name: hard_target_diameter_vectorized

sect1.title: Description
sect1.para: This function estimates the diamter of a hard target based on the signal-to-noise ratio (energy-to-noise). Assume a smooth transition between Rayleigh and optical scattering. Ignore Mie regime and use either optical or Rayleigh scatter.

memberdef.argsstring: (double _gain_tx, double _gain_rx, double _wavelength, double _power_tx, double _range_tx_m, double _range_rx_m, double _snr, double _bandwidth, double _rx_noise_temp, double _radar_albedo, double *_diameter)
memberdef.name: hard_target_diameter

sect1.title: Description
sect1.para: This function estimates the diamter of a hard target based on the signal-to-noise ratio (energy-to-noise). Assume a smooth transition between Rayleigh and optical scattering. Ignore Mie regime and use either optical or Rayleigh scatter.

memberdef.argsstring: (double *_gain_tx, double *_gain_rx, double _wavelength, double _power_tx, double *_range_tx_m, double *_range_rx_m, double _diameter, double _bandwidth, double _rx_noise_temp, double _radar_albedo, double *_snr, int _N)
memberdef.name: hard_target_snr_vectorized

sect1.title: Description
sect1.para: This function determines the Signal-to-Noise Ratio SNR (or energy-to-noise ratio) of a hard target. It assumes a smooth transition between the Rayleigh and optical scattering regimes. The Mie regime is ignored.

memberdef.argsstring: (double _gain_tx, double _gain_rx, double _wavelength, double _power_tx, double _range_tx_m, double _range_rx_m, double _diameter, double _bandwidth, double _rx_noise_temp, double _radar_albedo, double *_snr)
memberdef.name: hard_target_snr

sect1.title: Description
sect1.para: This function determines the signal-to-noise ratio (energy-to-noise) for a hard target. It assumes a smooth transition between the Rayleigh and optical scattering regimes. The Mie regime is ignored.
